moves.1. Nc3 e5: By discouraging d4, black is close to equal.  However, I am not sure that I want to face 2. e4 going into a Vienna.
moves.8... Ba5: The difference between playing this first before h4, which is still a great move, is that play could follow b4 h4, Be5 Nxe5, bxa5 with the pawn weak on  a5 instead of b4 and the c3 square is open to place a knight.
moves.9. b4 h4 10. bxa5: 10. Bd6 a6 11. Nxd4 Nc3 12. Nxc6 dxc6 13. Qc1 Qxd6 14. bxa5 Qf6 [with a much better game.  For example ...] 15. e3 Be6 16. Qb2 O-O-O 17. Bd3 Rh5 18. Rc1 h3 19. g3 Rxa5 20. moves.15... Qxe4 16. Nxe4 Nc2+: The game is over, but what follows is interesting.
moves.20. Rxa1 Rxh2 21. Nc3 Rb2+ 22. Ne2 Rh6: Everything is winning, but this is the best.
moves.23. Kf3: 23. Re1  Makes more sense. Rf6+ 24. Kg1 g5 White has few good moves.
